private_information: I am the left peg agent controlling the left peg.
My current stack from top to bottom is: A, B, C, D, E, F, G (A is smallest, G is largest).
left_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks so that the right peg ends up with (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G.

private_information: I am the middle peg agent controlling the middle peg.
middle_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks so that the right peg ends up with (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G.

private_information: I am the right peg agent controlling the right peg.
right_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks so that the right peg ends up with (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G.

private_information: I coordinate the peg agents and assemble their reports into a complete planning problem.
I will produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Generate a complete, correct PDDL domain and problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance moving 7 disks from left to right under the standard rules.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 7 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G from smallest (A) to largest (G).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL problems and planners. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the agents. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent responsibilities distinct where relevant and ensure predicates and actions are unambiguous for FastDownwards. The problem must capture 7 disks (A..G), pegs left/middle/right, the initial configuration, and the goal configuration. Do not modify agent identities; integrate their state reports to form the initial state.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You received the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You received these agent state descriptions: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right}. Your task: produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that FastDownwards can consume to solve the task {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Make sure to represent disk sizes, pegs, the legal move action (moving top disk from one peg to another respecting size constraints), initial state, and goal. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
